intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create the famous "Hello World"application and try it out. You will create a Ruby project and a Ruby class that will print "Hello world!" in the console when run.
If you need help at any step, click the (?) to the right. Let's getstarted!

item.title: Open the Ruby perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the Ruby perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Rubyor click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create a Ruby project
item.description: Before creating a class, we need a project to put it in. In the main toolbar, click on the New Ruby Project button, or click on the link below. Enter HelloWorld for the project name, then click Finish.

item.title: Create your HelloWorld script
item.description:
The next step is to create a new ruby script. In the main menu select File > New > File (or the link below). Select the HelloWorld project as the folder, enter helloworld.rb for the file name, then click Finish.
The Ruby editor will automatically open showing your new script.

item.title: Add a print statement
item.description:
Now that you have your helloworld.rb script, add the following statement:
puts "Hello world!"
Then save your changes.

item.title: Run your Ruby application
item.description:
To run your application, right-click on the helloworld.rb file in the Ruby Resources view and select Run As > Ruby Application. The Console view should appear at the bottom and display the "Hello, world!" output.
Congratulations! You have successfully created a Hello World application!
